content.introduction: Understanding large numbers, place value system, comparison and estimation of numbers.

topics.title: Place Value System
topics.description: Indian and International place value systems are used to read and write large numbers.
definitions: Place Value: The value of a digit based on its position.
Face Value: The actual value of a digit.

topics.title: Comparing Numbers
topics.description: We compare by counting digits or checking place values.
examples: 56789 > 34567 because 56 thousand is greater than 34 thousand

topics.title: Estimation and Rounding
topics.description: Numbers can be rounded to nearest tens, hundreds, thousands for quick calculations.

solved_examples.question: Write 3,50,67,281 in words (Indian System).
solved_examples.solution: Three crore fifty lakh sixty-seven thousand two hundred eighty-one

long_questions: Explain the Indian and International place value systems with examples.
Round these numbers to nearest thousand: 5432, 8132, 1999.
real_life_applications: Used in reading population numbers, bank balance, electricity bills.
Rounding helps in estimating shopping bills or distances.

content.introduction: Study of natural numbers, whole numbers, their properties and number line.

topics.title: Natural and Whole Numbers
topics.description: Natural numbers start from 1, whole numbers start from 0.

topics.title: Number Line
topics.description: Numbers arranged on a line from smallest to largest.

solved_examples.question: Is 0 a natural number?
solved_examples.solution: No, 0 is not a natural number but it is a whole number.

long_questions: Write and explain the properties of whole numbers with examples.
Draw a number line from 0 to 20.
real_life_applications: Used to count objects and represent money, distance, population.

content.introduction: Understanding factors, multiples, prime and composite numbers, LCM and HCF.

topics.title: Factors and Multiples
topics.description: Factors divide a number exactly; multiples are products of the number.

topics.title: Prime and Composite Numbers
topics.description: Prime numbers have 2 factors; composite have more than 2.

topics.title: LCM and HCF
topics.description: LCM = smallest common multiple; HCF = greatest common factor

formulas: LCM × HCF = Product of numbers (for two numbers)

mcqs.q: Which is the smallest prime number?

long_questions: Find LCM and HCF of 12 and 18.
real_life_applications: Used in dividing items into equal groups, arranging teams etc.
